occupation: Founder | Design of the Technology at Pillotech
headline: working on the future of textiles
summary:
l am working on polymers, electronics, and textiles at the same time to contribute to the creation of next generation of wearables and soft-robotics. I have a depiction of a future that I cannot resist, where society is more mobile, free, minimalist, and vibrant than it was ever before. 

I am particularly focusing on the manifacturing of electroactive fibers, flexible electronics, and artificial muscles. I believe that it is possible to invent many types of wearables by combining different types of electroactive polymers with flexible electronic circuits. Therefore, my current research targets the synthesis and optimization of fiber actuators, which are capable of setting up the basis for artificial muscles and smart textiles.

experiences.company: SUNUM-Sabancı University Nanotechnology Research and Application Center
experiences.title: Researcher - Conductive Elastic Nanofiber Films for Stretchable Lithium-ion Batteries
experiences.description:
The production of stretchable batteries will be a milestone in flexible electronics. Although most of the electronic components have been succefully converted to flexible parts in the past decade, conversion of rigid lithium-ion batteries still remains as a challenge.

1. Conducted a study on nanofiber based conductive elastic films that could be used as stretchable lithium-ion battery components and published a report introducing the first steps of the production.
2. Provided the experimental results and the analysis of two different elastomeric polymers, TPU and SEBS, as candidates for conductive and flexible nanofiber films.
3. Produced a polymeric surface that reached 100% stretchability. SEM imaging and eletrospinning method are frequently used in the lab.

experiences.title: Researcher - Synthesis and optimization of silicon fiber actuators for smart textiles
experiences.description:
Electroactive polymers are fundamental materials for soft robotics and wearable technology applications, and among different types of electroactive polymers, silicon elastomeric fibers may be the most advantageous choice for creating electroactive yarns in smart textiles and artifical muscles.

Accomplishments:
Co-authored a paper detailing on optimal design criteria for silicon fiber actuators to be presented at SPIE EAPAD XXVI, March 2024 Los Angeles.

Invented a new mechanism for the production of silicon fiber actuators and prepared 15 pages report explaining both current problems in production and detailing how the mechanism solved 9 major problems encountered during production.


Tasks:
-Preparation of silicon elastomeric fiber actuators via wet spinning and photopolymerization. A coaxial spinneret is utilized for the fabrication of 3 layered actuator, where it is coated with carbon grease as outer shell and ionic liquid as the inner core electrode.
-Testing mechanical properties of hollowed silicon fibers.
-Measuring of actuation data under controlled high voltage.

accomplishment_projects.title: Civic Involvement Project: Design of a water-free siphon mechanism based on capsules to prevent sanitation related problems and minimize water consumption
accomplishment_projects.description: 2.3 billion people are deprived of basic sanitation systems due to lack of plumbing. Excretory wastes released into rivers and soil cause the rapid spread of many tropical deadly diseases, causing 775,000 deaths each year. Moreover, unsafe sanitation causes many social problems for education and gender equality. After an extensive research, we offered an innovative solution to the topic and designed a water-free siphon mechanism via SolidWorks.
